oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1943-01-02 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from January 2, 1943. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with vocalist San Antonio Rose, Pap's Jug Band, Ford Rush, Minnie Pearl, and Art Wooten. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ford Rush; Minnie Pearl; Bashful Brother Oswald; Art Wooten; Roy Acuff
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay introduces Trudy Brown -- Trudy Brown interviews service men -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- Maple On The Hill (Ford Rush) -- George D. Hay introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Lulu Walls (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (George D. Hay, Louie Buck) -- George D. Hay introduces Rachel Veach and Bashful Brother Oswald -- Bashful Brother Oswald reads a poem -- George D. Hay introduces Art Wooten -- Katy Hill (Art Wooten) -- 'Bits and pieces method' P.S.A. (Louie Buck) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay, Bashful Brother Oswald)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Pap's Jug Band; Wilson, Lonnie; Minnie Pearl; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Wooten, Art, 1906-1986
